00028 /*
00029  * Wish list for array classes.
00030  *  - Arrays whose dimensions are unknown at compile time.
00031  *  - where()/elsewhere()/elsewhere() as in Dan Quinlan's implementation
00032  *  - block reduction operations
00033  *  - conversion to/from matrix & vector
00034  *  - apply(T func(T))
00035  *  - apply(T func(const T&))
00036  *  - apply<T func(T)>
00037  */
00038 
00039 #ifndef BZ_ARRAY_H
00040 #define BZ_ARRAY_H

00088 /*
00089  * Declaration of class Array
00090  */
00091 
00092 // NEEDS_WORK: Array should inherit protected from MemoryBlockReference.
00093 // To make this work, need to expose MemoryBlockReference::numReferences()
00094 // and make Array<P,N2> a friend of Array<P,N> for slicing.
00095 
00096 template<typename P_numtype, int N_rank>
00097 class Array : public MemoryBlockReference<P_numtype> 
00098 #ifdef BZ_NEW_EXPRESSION_TEMPLATES
00099     , public ETBase<Array<P_numtype,N_rank> >
00100 #endif
00101 {
00102 
00103 private:
00104     typedef MemoryBlockReference<P_numtype> T_base;
00105     using T_base::data_;
00106 
00107 public:
00109     // Public Types
00111 
00112     /*
00113      * T_numtype  is the numeric type stored in the array.
00114      * T_index    is a vector type which can be used to access elements
00115      *            of many-dimensional arrays.
00116      * T_array    is the array type itself -- Array<T_numtype, N_rank>
00117      * T_iterator is a a fast iterator for the array, used for expression
00118      *            templates
00119      * iterator   is a STL-style iterator
00120      * const_iterator is an STL-style const iterator
00121      */
00122 
00123     typedef P_numtype                T_numtype;
00124     typedef TinyVector<int, N_rank>  T_index;
00125     typedef Array<T_numtype, N_rank> T_array;
00126     typedef FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank> T_iterator;
00127 
00128     typedef ArrayIterator<T_numtype,N_rank> iterator;
00129     typedef ConstArrayIterator<T_numtype,N_rank> const_iterator;
00130 
00131     static const int _bz_rank = N_rank;
00132 
00134     // Constructors                             //
00136 
00137     
00138     /*
00139      * Construct an array from an array expression.
00140      */
00141 
00142     template<typename T_expr>
00143     explicit Array(_bz_ArrayExpr<T_expr> expr);
00144 
00145     /*
00146      * Any missing length arguments will have their value taken from the
00147      * last argument.  For example,
00148      *   Array<int,3> A(32,64);
00149      * will create a 32x64x64 array.  This is handled by setupStorage().
00150      */
00151 
00152     Array(GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00153         : storage_(storage)
00154     {
00155         length_ = 0;
00156         stride_ = 0;
00157         zeroOffset_ = 0;
00158     }
00159 
00160     explicit Array(int length0, 
00161         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00162         : storage_(storage)
00163     {
00164         length_[0] = length0;
00165         setupStorage(0);
00166     }
00167 
00168     Array(int length0, int length1,
00169         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00170         : storage_(storage)
00171     {
00172         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 2);
00173         TAU_TYPE_STRING(p1, "Array<T,N>::Array() [T="
00174             + CT(T_numtype) + ",N=" + CT(N_rank) + "]");
00175         TAU_PROFILE(p1, "void (int,int)", TAU_BLITZ);
00176 
00177         length_[0] = length0;
00178         length_[1] = length1;
00179         setupStorage(1);
00180     }
00181 
00182     Array(int length0, int length1, int length2,
00183         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00184         : storage_(storage)
00185     {
00186         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 3);
00187         length_[0] = length0;
00188         length_[1] = length1;
00189         length_[2] = length2;
00190         setupStorage(2);
00191     }
00192 
00193     Array(int length0, int length1, int length2, int length3,
00194         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00195         : storage_(storage)
00196     {
00197         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 4);
00198         length_[0] = length0;
00199         length_[1] = length1;
00200         length_[2] = length2;
00201         length_[3] = length3;
00202         setupStorage(3);
00203     }
00204 
00205     Array(int length0, int length1, int length2, int length3, int length4,
00206         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00207         : storage_(storage)
00208     {
00209         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 5);
00210         length_[0] = length0;
00211         length_[1] = length1;
00212         length_[2] = length2;
00213         length_[3] = length3;
00214         length_[4] = length4;
00215         setupStorage(4);
00216     }
00217

00219         int length5,
00220         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00221         : storage_(storage)
00222     {
00223         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 6);
00224         length_[0] = length0;
00225         length_[1] = length1;
00226         length_[2] = length2;
00227         length_[3] = length3;
00228         length_[4] = length4;
00229         length_[5] = length5;
00230         setupStorage(5);
00231     }

00234         int length5, int length6,
00235         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00236         : storage_(storage)

00239         length_[0] = length0;
00240         length_[1] = length1;
00241         length_[2] = length2;

00245         length_[6] = length6;

00250         int length5, int length6, int length7,
00251         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00252         : storage_(storage)

00254         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 8);
00255         length_[0] = length0;
00256         length_[1] = length1;

00260         length_[5] = length5;

00268         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())

00281         setupStorage(8);

00284     Array(int length0, int length1, int length2, int length3, int length4,
00285         int length5, int length6, int length7, int length8, int length9,
00286         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00287         : storage_(storage)
00288     {

00290         length_[0] = length0;

00297         length_[7] = length7;
00298         length_[8] = length8;
00299         length_[9] = length9;
00300         setupStorage(9);
00301     }
00302 
00303     Array(int length0, int length1, int length2, int length3, int length4,
00304         int length5, int length6, int length7, int length8, int length9,
00305         int length10,
00306         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00307         : storage_(storage)
00308     {
00309         BZPRECONDITION(N_rank >= 11);
00310         length_[0] = length0;
00311         length_[1] = length1;
00312         length_[2] = length2;
00313         length_[3] = length3;
00314         length_[4] = length4;
00315         length_[5] = length5;
00316         length_[6] = length6;
00317         length_[7] = length7;
00318         length_[8] = length8;
00319         length_[9] = length9;
00320         length_[10] = length10;
00321         setupStorage(10);
00322     }
00323 
00324     /*
00325      * Construct an array from an existing block of memory.  Ownership
00326      * is not acquired (this is provided for backwards compatibility).
00327      */
00328     Array(T_numtype* restrict dataFirst, TinyVector<int, N_rank> shape,
00329         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00330       : MemoryBlockReference<T_numtype>(_bz_returntype<sizeType>::product(shape), dataFirst, 
00331           neverDeleteData),
00332         storage_(storage)
00333     {
00334         BZPRECONDITION(dataFirst != 0);
00335 
00336         length_ = shape;
00337         computeStrides();
00338         data_ += zeroOffset_;
00339     }
00340 
00341     /*
00342      * Construct an array from an existing block of memory, with a
00343      * given set of strides.  Ownership is not acquired (i.e. the memory
00344      * block will not be freed by Blitz++).
00345      */
00346     Array(T_numtype* restrict dataFirst, TinyVector<int, N_rank> shape,
00347         TinyVector<diffType, N_rank> stride, 
00348         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00349       : MemoryBlockReference<T_numtype>(_bz_returntype<sizeType>::product(shape), dataFirst, 
00350           neverDeleteData),
00351         storage_(storage)
00352     {
00353         BZPRECONDITION(dataFirst != 0);
00354 
00355         length_ = shape;
00356         stride_ = stride;
00357         calculateZeroOffset();
00358         data_ += zeroOffset_;
00359     }
00360 
00361     /*
00362      * Construct an array from an existing block of memory.
00363      */
00364     Array(T_numtype* restrict dataFirst, TinyVector<int, N_rank> shape,
00365         preexistingMemoryPolicy deletionPolicy,
00366         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00367       : MemoryBlockReference<T_numtype>(_bz_returntype<sizeType>::product(shape), dataFirst, 
00368             deletionPolicy),
00369         storage_(storage)
00370     {
00371         BZPRECONDITION(dataFirst != 0);
00372 
00373         length_ = shape;
00374         computeStrides();
00375         data_ += zeroOffset_;
00376 
00377         if (deletionPolicy == duplicateData)
00378             reference(copy());
00379     }
00380 
00381     /*
00382      * Construct an array from an existing block of memory, with a
00383      * given set of strides.  
00384      */
00385     Array(T_numtype* restrict dataFirst, TinyVector<int, N_rank> shape,
00386         TinyVector<diffType, N_rank> stride,
00387         preexistingMemoryPolicy deletionPolicy,
00388         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00389       : MemoryBlockReference<T_numtype>(_bz_returntype<sizeType>::product(shape), dataFirst, 
00390           deletionPolicy),
00391         storage_(storage)
00392     {
00393         BZPRECONDITION(dataFirst != 0);
00394 
00395         length_ = shape;
00396         stride_ = stride;
00397         calculateZeroOffset();
00398         data_ += zeroOffset_;
00399 
00400         if (deletionPolicy == duplicateData)
00401             reference(copy());
00402     }
00403 
00404     /*
00405      * This constructor takes an extent (length) vector and storage format.
00406      */
00407 
00408     Array(const TinyVector<int, N_rank>& extent, 
00409         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00410         : storage_(storage)
00411     {
00412         length_ = extent;
00413         setupStorage(N_rank - 1);
00414     }
00415 
00416     /*
00417      * This construct takes a vector of bases (lbounds) and a vector of
00418      * extents.
00419      */
00420 
00421     Array(const TinyVector<int, N_rank>& lbounds,
00422         const TinyVector<int, N_rank>& extent,
00423         const GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>& storage 
00424            = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>());
00425 
00426     /*
00427      * These constructors allow arbitrary bases (starting indices) to be set.
00428      * e.g. Array<int,2> A(Range(10,20), Range(20,30))
00429      * will create an 11x11 array whose indices are 10..20 and 20..30
00430      */
00431     Array(Range r0, 
00432         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00433         : storage_(storage)
00434     {
00435         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous());
00436 
00437         length_[0] = r0.length();
00438         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00439         setupStorage(0);
00440     }
00441 
00442     Array(Range r0, Range r1,
00443         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00444         : storage_(storage)
00445     {
00446         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() && 
00447             r1.isAscendingContiguous());
00448 
00449         length_[0] = r0.length();
00450         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00451         length_[1] = r1.length();
00452         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00453 
00454         setupStorage(1);
00455     }
00456 
00457     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2,
00458         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00459         : storage_(storage)
00460     {
00461         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() &&
00462             r1.isAscendingContiguous() && r2.isAscendingContiguous());
00463 
00464         length_[0] = r0.length();
00465         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00466         length_[1] = r1.length();
00467         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00468         length_[2] = r2.length();
00469         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00470 
00471         setupStorage(2);
00472     }
00473 
00474     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3,
00475         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00476         : storage_(storage)
00477     {
00478         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() &&
00479             r1.isAscendingContiguous() && r2.isAscendingContiguous()
00480             && r3.isAscendingContiguous());
00481 
00482         length_[0] = r0.length();
00483         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00484         length_[1] = r1.length();
00485         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00486         length_[2] = r2.length();
00487         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00488         length_[3] = r3.length();
00489         storage_.setBase(3, r3.first());
00490 
00491         setupStorage(3);
00492     }
00493 
00494     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3, Range r4,
00495         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00496         : storage_(storage)
00497     {
00498         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() &&
00499             r1.isAscendingContiguous() && r2.isAscendingContiguous()
00500             && r3.isAscendingContiguous() && r4.isAscendingContiguous());
00501 
00502         length_[0] = r0.length();
00503         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00504         length_[1] = r1.length();
00505         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00506         length_[2] = r2.length();
00507         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00508         length_[3] = r3.length();
00509         storage_.setBase(3, r3.first());
00510         length_[4] = r4.length();
00511         storage_.setBase(4, r4.first());
00512 
00513         setupStorage(4);
00514     }

00516     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3, Range r4, Range r5,
00517         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00518         : storage_(storage)

00528         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());

00530         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00531         length_[3] = r3.length();

00600     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3, Range r4, Range r5,

00611         length_[0] = r0.length();
00612         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00613         length_[1] = r1.length();
00614         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00615         length_[2] = r2.length();
00616         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00617         length_[3] = r3.length();
00618         storage_.setBase(3, r3.first());
00619         length_[4] = r4.length();
00620         storage_.setBase(4, r4.first());
00621         length_[5] = r5.length();
00622         storage_.setBase(5, r5.first());
00623         length_[6] = r6.length();
00624         storage_.setBase(6, r6.first());
00625         length_[7] = r7.length();
00626         storage_.setBase(7, r7.first());
00627         length_[8] = r8.length();
00628         storage_.setBase(8, r8.first());
00629 
00630         setupStorage(8);
00631     }
00632 
00633     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3, Range r4, Range r5,
00634         Range r6, Range r7, Range r8, Range r9,
00635         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00636         : storage_(storage)
00637     {
00638         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() &&
00639             r1.isAscendingContiguous() && r2.isAscendingContiguous()
00640             && r3.isAscendingContiguous() && r4.isAscendingContiguous()
00641             && r5.isAscendingContiguous() && r6.isAscendingContiguous()
00642             && r7.isAscendingContiguous() && r8.isAscendingContiguous()
00643             && r9.isAscendingContiguous());
00644 
00645         length_[0] = r0.length();
00646         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00647         length_[1] = r1.length();
00648         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00649         length_[2] = r2.length();
00650         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00651         length_[3] = r3.length();
00652         storage_.setBase(3, r3.first());
00653         length_[4] = r4.length();
00654         storage_.setBase(4, r4.first());
00655         length_[5] = r5.length();
00656         storage_.setBase(5, r5.first());
00657         length_[6] = r6.length();
00658         storage_.setBase(6, r6.first());
00659         length_[7] = r7.length();
00660         storage_.setBase(7, r7.first());
00661         length_[8] = r8.length();
00662         storage_.setBase(8, r8.first());
00663         length_[9] = r9.length();
00664         storage_.setBase(9, r9.first());
00665 
00666         setupStorage(9);
00667     }
00668 
00669     Array(Range r0, Range r1, Range r2, Range r3, Range r4, Range r5,
00670         Range r6, Range r7, Range r8, Range r9, Range r10,
00671         GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage = GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank>())
00672         : storage_(storage)
00673     {
00674         BZPRECONDITION(r0.isAscendingContiguous() &&
00675             r1.isAscendingContiguous() && r2.isAscendingContiguous()
00676             && r3.isAscendingContiguous() && r4.isAscendingContiguous()
00677             && r5.isAscendingContiguous() && r6.isAscendingContiguous()
00678             && r7.isAscendingContiguous() && r8.isAscendingContiguous()
00679             && r9.isAscendingContiguous() && r10.isAscendingContiguous());
00680 
00681         length_[0] = r0.length();
00682         storage_.setBase(0, r0.first());
00683         length_[1] = r1.length();
00684         storage_.setBase(1, r1.first());
00685         length_[2] = r2.length();
00686         storage_.setBase(2, r2.first());
00687         length_[3] = r3.length();
00688         storage_.setBase(3, r3.first());
00689         length_[4] = r4.length();
00690         storage_.setBase(4, r4.first());
00691         length_[5] = r5.length();
00692         storage_.setBase(5, r5.first());
00693         length_[6] = r6.length();
00694         storage_.setBase(6, r6.first());
00695         length_[7] = r7.length();
00696         storage_.setBase(7, r7.first());
00697         length_[8] = r8.length();
00698         storage_.setBase(8, r8.first());
00699         length_[9] = r9.length();
00700         storage_.setBase(9, r9.first());
00701         length_[10] = r10.length();
00702         storage_.setBase(10, r10.first());
00703 
00704         setupStorage(10);
00705     }

00731     /*
00732      * These constructors make the array a view of a subportion of another
00733      * array.  If there fewer than N_rank Range arguments provided, no
00734      * slicing is performed in the unspecified ranks.
00735      * e.g. Array<int,3> A(20,20,20);
00736      *      Array<int,3> B(A, Range(5,15));
00737      * is equivalent to:
00738      *      Array<int,3> B(A, Range(5,15), Range::all(), Range::all());
00739      */
00740     Array(Array<T_numtype, N_rank>& array, Range r0)
00741     {
00742         constructSubarray(array, r0);
00743     }
00744 
00745     Array(Array<T_numtype, N_rank>& array, Range r0, Range r1)
00746     {
00747         constructSubarray(array, r0, r1);
00748     }
00749

00751     {
00752         constructSubarray(array, r0, r1, r2);
00753     }
00754

00758         constructSubarray(array, r0, r1, r2, r3);
00759     }

00861     T_array                           copy() const;
00862 
00863     // data_ always refers to the point (0,0,...,0) which may
00864     // not be in the array if the base is not zero in each rank.
00865     // These data() routines return a pointer to the first
00866     // element in the array (but note that it may not be
00867     // stored first in memory if some ranks are stored descending).
00868 
00869     diffType                               dataOffset() const
00870   { return dot(storage_.base(), stride_); }
00871 
00872     const T_numtype* restrict         data() const
00873     { return data_ + dataOffset(); }
00874 
00875     T_numtype* restrict               data() 
00876     { return data_ + dataOffset(); }
00877 
00878     // These dataZero() routines refer to the point (0,0,...,0)
00879     // which may not be in the array if the bases are nonzero.
00880     
00881     const T_numtype* restrict         dataZero() const
00882     { return data_; }
00883 
00884     T_numtype* restrict               dataZero()
00885     { return data_; }
00886 
00887     // These dataFirst() routines refer to the element in the
00888     // array which falls first in memory.
00889 
00890     diffType                               dataFirstOffset() const
00891     {
00892       diffType pos = 0;
00893 
00894         // Used to use tinyvector expressions:
00895         // return data_ + dot(storage_.base()
00896         //     + (1 - storage_.ascendingFlag()) * (length_ - 1), stride_);
00897 
00898         for (int i=0; i < N_rank; ++i)
00899            pos += (storage_.base(i) + (1-storage_.isRankStoredAscending(i)) *
00900        (length_(i)-1)) * stride_(i);
00901 
00902         return pos;
00903     }
00904     
00905     const T_numtype* restrict         dataFirst() const
00906     { return data_ + dataFirstOffset(); }
00907 
00908     T_numtype* restrict               dataFirst()
00909     { return data_ + dataFirstOffset(); }
00910 
00911     int                               depth() const
00912     { return length_[2]; }
00913 
00914     int                               dimensions() const
00915     { return N_rank; }
00916 
00917     RectDomain<N_rank>                domain() const
00918     { return RectDomain<N_rank>(lbound(), ubound()); }
00919 
00920     void dumpStructureInformation(ostream& os = cout) const;
00921 
00922     iterator                          end()
00923     { return iterator(*this,0); }
00924 
00925     const_iterator                    end() const
00926     { return const_iterator(*this,0); }

00968     // NEEDS_WORK -- Expose the numReferences() method

00971     // The storage_.ordering_ array is a list of dimensions from
00972     // the most minor (stride 1) to major dimension.  Generally,
00973     // ordering(0) will return the dimension which has the smallest
00974     // stride, and ordering(N_rank-1) will return the dimension with
00975     // the largest stride.
00976     int                               ordering(int storageRankIndex) const
00977     { return storage_.ordering(storageRankIndex); }

01124     bool                              threadLocal(bool disableLock = true) const

01127     int                               ubound(int rank) const
01128     { return base(rank) + length_(rank) - 1; }
01129 
01130     TinyVector<int, N_rank>           ubound() const
01131     { 
01132         TinyVector<int, N_rank> ub;
01133         for (int i=0; i < N_rank; ++i)
01134           ub(i) = base(i) + extent(i) - 1;
01135         // WAS: ub = base() + extent() - 1;
01136         return ub;
01137     }

01139     int                               zeroOffset() const
01140     { return zeroOffset_; }
01141 
01143     // Debugging routines
01145 
01146     bool isInRangeForDim(int i, int d) const {
01147         return i >= base(d) && (i - base(d)) < length_[d];
01148     }
01149 
01150     bool isInRange(int i0) const {
01151         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0];
01152     }
01153 
01154     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1) const {
01155         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01156             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1];
01157     }
01158 
01159     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2) const {
01160         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01161             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01162             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2];
01163     }
01164 
01165     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3) const {
01166         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01167             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01168             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01169             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3];
01170     }
01171 
01172     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4) const {
01173         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01174             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01175             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01176             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01177             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4];
01178     }
01179 
01180     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4, int i5) const {
01181         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01182             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01183             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01184             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01185             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01186             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5];
01187     }
01188 
01189     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4, int i5, int i6) const {
01190         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01191             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01192             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01193             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01194             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01195             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5]
01196             && i6 >= base(6) && (i6 - base(6)) < length_[6];
01197     }
01198 
01199     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4,
01200         int i5, int i6, int i7) const {
01201         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01202             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01203             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01204             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01205             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01206             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5]
01207             && i6 >= base(6) && (i6 - base(6)) < length_[6]
01208             && i7 >= base(7) && (i7 - base(7)) < length_[7];
01209     }
01210 
01211     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4,
01212         int i5, int i6, int i7, int i8) const {
01213         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01214             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01215             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01216             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01217             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01218             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5]
01219             && i6 >= base(6) && (i6 - base(6)) < length_[6]
01220             && i7 >= base(7) && (i7 - base(7)) < length_[7]
01221             && i8 >= base(8) && (i8 - base(8)) < length_[8];
01222     }
01223 
01224     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4,
01225         int i5, int i6, int i7, int i8, int i9) const {
01226         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01227             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01228             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01229             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01230             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01231             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5]
01232             && i6 >= base(6) && (i6 - base(6)) < length_[6]
01233             && i7 >= base(7) && (i7 - base(7)) < length_[7]
01234             && i8 >= base(8) && (i8 - base(8)) < length_[8]
01235             && i9 >= base(9) && (i9 - base(9)) < length_[9];
01236     }
01237 
01238     bool isInRange(int i0, int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4,
01239         int i5, int i6, int i7, int i8, int i9, int i10) const {
01240         return i0 >= base(0) && (i0 - base(0)) < length_[0]
01241             && i1 >= base(1) && (i1 - base(1)) < length_[1]
01242             && i2 >= base(2) && (i2 - base(2)) < length_[2]
01243             && i3 >= base(3) && (i3 - base(3)) < length_[3]
01244             && i4 >= base(4) && (i4 - base(4)) < length_[4]
01245             && i5 >= base(5) && (i5 - base(5)) < length_[5]
01246             && i6 >= base(6) && (i6 - base(6)) < length_[6]
01247             && i7 >= base(7) && (i7 - base(7)) < length_[7]
01248             && i8 >= base(8) && (i8 - base(8)) < length_[8]
01249             && i9 >= base(9) && (i9 - base(9)) < length_[9]
01250             && i10 >= base(10) && (i10 - base(10)) < length_[10];
01251     }
01252 
01253     bool isInRange(const T_index& index) const {
01254         for (int i=0; i < N_rank; ++i)
01255             if (index[i] < base(i) || (index[i] - base(i)) >= length_[i])
01256                 return false;
01257 
01258         return true;
01259     }
01260 
01261     bool assertInRange(const T_index& BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(index)) const {
01262         BZPRECHECK(isInRange(index), "Array index out of range: " << index
01263             << endl << "Lower bounds: " << storage_.base() << endl
01264             <<         "Length:       " << length_ << endl);
01265         return true;
01266     }
01267 
01268     bool assertInRange(int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i0)) const {
01269         BZPRECHECK(isInRange(i0), "Array index out of range: " << i0
01270             << endl << "Lower bounds: " << storage_.base() << endl
01271             <<         "Length:       " << length_ << endl);
01272         return true;
01273     }
01274 
01275     bool assertInRange(int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i0), int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i1)) const {
01276         BZPRECHECK(isInRange(i0,i1), "Array index out of range: (" 
01277             << i0 << ", " << i1 << ")"
01278             << endl << "Lower bounds: " << storage_.base() << endl
01279             <<         "Length:       " << length_ << endl);
01280         return true;
01281     }
01282 
01283     bool assertInRange(int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i0), int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i1),
01284         int BZ_DEBUG_PARAM(i2)) const
01285     {
01286         BZPRECHECK(isInRange(i0,i1,i2), "Array index out of range: ("
01287             << i0 << ", " << i1 << ", " << i2 << ")"
01288             << endl << "Lower bounds: " << storage_.base() << endl
01289             <<         "Length:       " << length_ << endl);
01290         return true;
01291     }

01401     // Subscripting operators
01403 
01404     template<int N_rank2>
01405     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(const TinyVector<int,N_rank2>& index) const
01406     {
01407         assertInRange(index);
01408         return data_[dot(index, stride_)];
01409     }
01410 
01411     template<int N_rank2>
01412     T_numtype& restrict operator()(const TinyVector<int,N_rank2>& index) 
01413     {
01414         assertInRange(index);
01415         return data_[dot(index, stride_)];
01416     }
01417 
01418     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(TinyVector<int,1> index) const
01419     {
01420         assertInRange(index[0]);
01421         return data_[index[0] * stride_[0]];
01422     }
01423 
01424     T_numtype& operator()(TinyVector<int,1> index)
01425     {
01426         assertInRange(index[0]);
01427         return data_[index[0] * stride_[0]];
01428     }
01429 
01430     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(TinyVector<int,2> index) const
01431     {
01432         assertInRange(index[0], index[1]);
01433         return data_[index[0] * stride_[0] 
01434          + index[1] * stride_[1]];
01435     }
01436 
01437     T_numtype& operator()(TinyVector<int,2> index)
01438     {
01439         assertInRange(index[0], index[1]);
01440         return data_[index[0] * stride_[0] 
01441          + index[1] * stride_[1]];
01442     }
01443 
01444     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(TinyVector<int,3> index) const
01445     {
01446         assertInRange(index[0], index[1], index[2]);
01447         return data_[(index[0]) * stride_[0] 
01448          + index[1] * stride_[1]
01449          + index[2] * stride_[2]];
01450     }

01456          + index[1] * stride_[1]
01457          + index[2] * stride_[2]];

01622     T_numtype& operator()(const TinyVector<int,11>& index)
01623     {
01624         assertInRange(index[0], index[1], index[2], index[3],
01625             index[4], index[5], index[6], index[7], index[8], index[9],
01626             index[10]);
01627         return data_[(index[0]) * stride_[0]
01628          + index[1] * stride_[1]
01629          + index[2] * stride_[2] + index[3] * stride_[3]
01630          + index[4] * stride_[4] + index[5] * stride_[5]
01631          + index[6] * stride_[6] + index[7] * stride_[7]
01632          + index[8] * stride_[8] + index[9] * stride_[9]
01633          + index[10] * stride_[10]];
01634     }
01635 
01636     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0) const
01637     { 
01638         assertInRange(i0);
01639         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0]]; 
01640     }
01641 
01642     T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0) 
01643     {
01644         assertInRange(i0);
01645         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0]];
01646     }
01647 
01648     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0, int i1) const
01649     { 
01650         assertInRange(i0, i1);
01651         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0] + i1 * stride_[1]];
01652     }
01653 
01654     T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0, int i1)
01655     {
01656         assertInRange(i0, i1);
01657         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0] + i1 * stride_[1]];
01658     }
01659 
01660     const T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0, int i1, int i2) const
01661     {
01662         assertInRange(i0, i1, i2);
01663         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0] + i1 * stride_[1]
01664          + i2 * stride_[2]];
01665     }
01666 
01667     T_numtype& restrict operator()(int i0, int i1, int i2) 
01668     {
01669         assertInRange(i0, i1, i2);
01670         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0] + i1 * stride_[1]
01671          + i2 * stride_[2]];
01672     }
01673

01675     {
01676         assertInRange(i0, i1, i2, i3);
01677         return data_[(i0) * stride_[0] + i1 * stride_[1]
01678          + i2 * stride_[2] + i3 * stride_[3]];
01679     }

01685          + i2 * stride_[2] + i3 * stride_[3]];

01820     /*
01821      * Slicing to produce subarrays.  If the number of Range arguments is
01822      * fewer than N_rank, then missing arguments are treated like Range::all().
01823      */
01824 
01825     T_array& noConst() const
01826     { return const_cast<T_array&>(*this); }
01827 
01828     T_array operator()(const RectDomain<N_rank>& subdomain) const
01829     {
01830         return T_array(noConst(), subdomain);
01831     }

01835     {
01836         return T_array(noConst(), subdomain);
01837     }

01842     }

01847     }

01899 
01900     // Allow any mixture of Range, int and Vector<int> objects as
01901     // operands for operator():   A(Range(3,7), 5, Range(2,4))
01902 
01903     /*
01904      * These versions of operator() allow any combination of int
01905      * and Range operands to be used.  Each int operand reduces
01906      * the rank of the resulting array by one.  
01907      *
01908      * e.g.  Array<int,4> A(20,20,20,20);
01909      *       Array<int,2> B = A(Range(5,15), 3, 5, Range(8,9));
01910      *
01911      * SliceInfo is a helper class defined in <blitz/arrayslice.h>.
01912      * It counts the number of Range vs. int arguments and does some
01913      * other helpful things.
01914      *
01915      * Once partial specialization becomes widely implemented, these
01916      * operators may be expanded to accept Vector<int> arguments
01917      * and produce ArrayPick<T,N> objects.
01918      *
01919      * This operator() is not provided with a single argument because
01920      * the appropriate cases exist above.
01921      */
01922 
01923 #ifdef BZ_HAVE_PARTIAL_ORDERING
01924 
01925     template<typename T1, typename T2>
01926     typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2>::T_slice
01927     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2) const
01928     {
01929         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2>::T_slice slice;
01930         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01931             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01932             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
01933     }
01934 
01935     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
01936     typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3>::T_slice 
01937     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3) const
01938     {
01939         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3>::T_slice slice;
01940         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01941             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01942             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
01943     }
01944 
01945     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4>
01946     typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4>::T_slice
01947     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4) const
01948     {
01949         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4>::T_slice slice;
01950         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01951             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01952             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
01953     }
01954 
01955     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5>
01956     typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5>::T_slice
01957     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4, T5 r5) const
01958     {
01959         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5>::T_slice slice;
01960         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, nilArraySection(),
01961             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01962             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
01963     }
01964 
01965     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5, typename T6>

01967     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4, T5 r5, T6 r6) const
01968     {
01969         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6>::T_slice slice;
01970         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, r6, nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(), nilArraySection(),
01971             nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
01972     }

01977     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4, T5 r5, T6 r6, T7 r7) const

01984     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5, typename T6,

01994     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5, typename T6,

01998     {

02000         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, r6, r7, r8, r9, nilArraySection(), nilArraySection());
02001     }

02003     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5, typename T6,

02006     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4, T5 r5, T6 r6, T7 r7, T8 r8, T9 r9, T10 r10) const
02007     {

02009         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, r6, r7, r8, r9, r10, nilArraySection());

02012     template<typename T1, typename T2, typename T3, typename T4, typename T5, typename T6,
02013         typename T7, typename T8, typename T9, typename T10, typename T11>
02014     typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,T10,T11>::T_slice
02015     operator()(T1 r1, T2 r2, T3 r3, T4 r4, T5 r5, T6 r6, T7 r7, T8 r8, T9 r9, T10 r10, T11 r11) const
02016     {
02017         typedef typename SliceInfo<T_numtype,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,T10,T11>::T_slice slice;
02018         return slice(noConst(), r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, r6, r7, r8, r9, r10, r11);
02019     }
02020 
02021 #endif // BZ_HAVE_PARTIAL_ORDERING
02022 
02023     /*
02024      * These versions of operator() are provided to support tensor-style
02025      * array notation, e.g.
02026      *
02027      * Array<float, 2> A, B;
02028      * firstIndex i;
02029      * secondIndex j;
02030      * thirdIndex k;
02031      * Array<float, 3> C = A(i,j) * B(j,k);
02032      */
02033 
02034     template<int N0>
02035     _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0> >
02036     operator()(IndexPlaceholder<N0>) const
02037     { 
02038         return _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0> >
02039             (noConst());
02040     }
02041 
02042     template<int N0, int N1>
02043     _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0, N1> >
02044     operator()(IndexPlaceholder<N0>, IndexPlaceholder<N1>) const
02045     {
02046         return _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0,
02047             N1> >(noConst());
02048     } 
02049 
02050     template<int N0, int N1, int N2>
02051     _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0, N1, N2> >
02052     operator()(IndexPlaceholder<N0>, IndexPlaceholder<N1>,
02053         IndexPlaceholder<N2>) const
02054     {
02055         return _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0,
02056             N1, N2> >(noConst());
02057     }
02058 
02059     template<int N0, int N1, int N2, int N3>
02060     _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0, N1, N2, N3> >
02061     operator()(IndexPlaceholder<N0>, IndexPlaceholder<N1>,
02062         IndexPlaceholder<N2>, IndexPlaceholder<N3>) const
02063     {
02064         return _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0,
02065             N1, N2, N3> >(noConst());
02066     }
02067 
02068     template<int N0, int N1, int N2, int N3, int N4>
02069     _bz_ArrayExpr<ArrayIndexMapping<FastArrayIterator<T_numtype, N_rank>, N0, N1, N2, N3, N4> >
02070     operator()(IndexPlaceholder<N0>, IndexPlaceholder<N1>,
02071         IndexPlaceholder<N2>, IndexPlaceholder<N3>, 
02072         IndexPlaceholder<N4>) const

02154     // Support for multicomponent arrays

02157     /*
02158      * See <blitz/array/multi.h> for an explanation of the traits class
02159      * multicomponent_traits.
02160      */
02161 
02162     Array<typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element,N_rank>
02163     operator[](const unsigned component) {
02164         typedef typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element T_compType;
02165 
02166         return extractComponent(T_compType(),component,
02167                                 multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::numComponents);
02168     }
02169 
02170     const Array<typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element,N_rank>
02171     operator[](const unsigned component) const {
02172         typedef typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element T_compType;
02173 
02174         return extractComponent(T_compType(),component,
02175                                 multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::numComponents);
02176     }
02177 
02178     Array<typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element,N_rank>
02179     operator[](const int component) {
02180         return operator[](static_cast<unsigned>(component));
02181     }
02182 
02183     const Array<typename multicomponent_traits<T_numtype>::T_element,N_rank>
02184     operator[](const int component) const {
02185         return operator[](static_cast<unsigned>(component));

02338     T_numtype* restrict getInitializationIterator() { return dataFirst(); }
02339 
02340     bool canCollapse(int outerRank, int innerRank) const { 
02341 #ifdef BZ_DEBUG_TRAVERSE
02342         BZ_DEBUG_MESSAGE("stride(" << innerRank << ")=" << stride(innerRank)
02343           << ", extent()=" << extent(innerRank) << ", stride(outerRank)="
02344           << stride(outerRank));
02345 #endif
02346         return (stride(innerRank) * extent(innerRank) == stride(outerRank)); 
02347     }

02407 protected:
02409     // Data members
02411 
02412     // NB: adding new data members may require changes to ctors, reference()
02413 
02414     /*
02415      * For a description of the storage_ members, see the comments for class 
02416      * GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> above.
02417      *
02418      * length_[] contains the extent of each rank.  E.g. a 10x20x30 array
02419      *           would have length_ = { 10, 20, 30}.
02420      * stride_[] contains the stride to move to the next element along each
02421      *           rank.
02422      * zeroOffset_ is the distance from the first element in the array 
02423      *           to the point (0,0,...,0).  If base_ is zero and all ranks are 
02424      *           stored ascending, then zeroOffset_ is zero.  This value
02425      *           is needed because to speed up indexing, the data_ member
02426      *           (inherited from MemoryBlockReference) always refers to
02427      *           (0,0,...,0).
02428      */
02429     GeneralArrayStorage<N_rank> storage_;
02430     TinyVector<int, N_rank> length_;
02431     TinyVector<diffType, N_rank> stride_;
02432     diffType zeroOffset_;
02433 };
02434 
02435 /*
02436  * Rank numbers start with zero, which may be confusing to users coming
02437  * from Fortran.  To make code more readable, the following constants
02438  * may help.  Example: instead of
02439  * 
02440  * int firstRankExtent = A.extent(0);
02441  *
02442  * One can write:
02443  *
02444  * int firstRankExtent = A.extent(firstRank);
02445  */
02446 
02447 const int firstRank    = 0;
02448 const int secondRank   = 1;
02449 const int thirdRank    = 2;
02450 const int fourthRank   = 3;
02451 const int fifthRank    = 4;
02452 const int sixthRank    = 5;
02453 const int seventhRank  = 6;
02454 const int eighthRank   = 7;
02455 const int ninthRank    = 8;
02456 const int tenthRank    = 9;
02457 const int eleventhRank = 10;
02458 
02459 const int firstDim    = 0;
02460 const int secondDim   = 1;
02461 const int thirdDim    = 2;
02462 const int fourthDim   = 3;
02463 const int fifthDim    = 4;
02464 const int sixthDim    = 5;
02465 const int seventhDim  = 6;
02466 const int eighthDim   = 7;
02467 const int ninthDim    = 8;
02468 const int tenthDim    = 9;
02469 const int eleventhDim = 10;

02472  * Global Functions
02473  */
02474 
02475 template<typename T_numtype>
02476 ostream& operator<<(ostream&, const Array<T_numtype,1>&);
02477 
02478 template<typename T_numtype, int N_rank>
02479 ostream& operator<<(ostream&, const Array<T_numtype,N_rank>&);
02480 
02481 template<typename T_numtype, int N_rank>
02482 istream& operator>>(istream& is, Array<T_numtype,N_rank>& x);
02483 
02484 template <typename P_numtype,int N_rank>
02485 void swap(Array<P_numtype,N_rank>& a,Array<P_numtype,N_rank>& b) {
02486     Array<P_numtype,N_rank> c(a);
02487     a.reference(b);
02488     b.reference(c);
02489 }
02490 
02491 template <typename P_expr>
02492 void find(Array<TinyVector<int,P_expr::rank>,1>& indices,
02493           const _bz_ArrayExpr<P_expr>& expr) {
02494     find(indices,
02495          static_cast< Array<typename P_expr::T_numtype,P_expr::rank> >(expr));
02496 }
02497 
02498 template <typename P_numtype, int N_rank>
02499 void find(Array<TinyVector<int,N_rank>,1>& indices,
02500           const Array<P_numtype,N_rank>& exprVals) {
02501     indices.resize(exprVals.size());
02502     typename Array<P_numtype,N_rank>::const_iterator it, end = exprVals.end();
02503     int j=0; 
02504     for (it = exprVals.begin(); it != end; ++it)
02505         if (*it) 
02506             indices(j++) = it.position();
02507     if (j) 
02508         indices.resizeAndPreserve(j);
02509     else 
02510         indices.free();
02511     return;
02512 }
